title: Man who groped TV reporter while she was on air in Spain is arrested
description: Isa Balado was reporting on a robbery in Madrid for channel Cuatro on Tuesday when the suspect approached her from behind and touched her rear end, video of the incident showed.

title: 'Stepping on dead people': Voices from flood-ravaged Libyan city
description: Thousands of people have been killed in the Libyan city of Derna in flooding. NBC News spoke to people on the ground who described the apocalyptical scenes.

title: Brazil’s Supreme Court sentences rioter who stormed capital to 17 years in prison
description: Brazil’s Supreme Court handed a 17-year prison sentence Thursday to a supporter of former President Jair Bolsonaro who stormed top government offices on Jan. 8 in an alleged bid to forcefully restore the right-wing leader to office.

title: Drone video captures scale of catastrophic Libya flooding
description: Mediterranean storm Daniel brought torrential rain that led to the failure of poorly maintained dams in the river valley above Derna. The deluge that followed killed thousands of people and destroyed large swathes of the city.

title: Russia expels two U.S. embassy staff
description: Russia said on Thursday it was expelling two U.S. diplomats it accused of working with a Russian national accused of collaborating with a foreign state.

title: American rescued from Turkish cave feared he was ‘probably not going to get out’
description: The American cave explorer who was rescued from a Turkish cave after being trapped for more than a week thought he was "probably not going to get out," he said Thursday.

title: Over 700 people tested for Nipah virus after two deaths in India
description: The southern Indian state of Kerala shut some schools, offices and public transport on Wednesday in a race to stop the spread of the rare and deadly Nipah virus, which has killed two people.

title: Rescued caver Mark Dickey says he will 'definitely continue to explore caves'
description: Mark Dickey, the U.S. scientist and adventurer who was rescued from thousands of feet underground in Turkey after falling ill, said that he will continue to explore caves.

title: Eyewitness tells of 60-foot wall of water flooding Derna, Libya
description: Moussa Ibrahim believed many of his relatives died after two dams burst above the Libyan coastal city of Derna, unleashing epic floods that wiped out neighborhoods and sent some of the dead into the sea.

title: Third attempt fails to free luxury cruise ship that ran aground in Greenland
description: The operator of a luxury cruise ship that ran aground in Greenland with 206 people on board said Thursday at least three passengers have contracted Covid-19.

title: Kim Jong Un invites Putin to North Korea after Russia summit
description: Kim Jong Un invited Russian President Vladimir Putin to visit North Korea during a rare summit, stoking U.S. concerns that a revived Moscow-Pyongyang axis could bolster Russia’s military in Ukraine and provide Kim sensitive missile technology.

title: Mexican lawmakers hear testimony on possible existence of extraterrestrials
description: The remains of alleged "nonhuman" beings were presented at Mexico’s first public congressional hearing on Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena, also known as UFOs.

title: Cruise ship runs aground in Greenland with hundreds aboard
description: A cruise ship with 206 passengers and crew ran aground in northwestern Greenland. Officials say rescue crews are on their way but warn it could take days before they arrive. NBC News' Rehema Ellis shares the latest.

title: Mexican artist Peso Pluma appears to receive death threats from cartel
description: A major threat against Mexican breakout star Peso Pluma was discovered just hours before he performed at MTV's Video Music Awards, banners of death threats appearing to be from one of Mexico’s leading cartels were hung around Tijuana. NBC News' Guad Venegas reports.
